cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT. CABINET. (n " b Memorandum by the Ministor of Labour. Engineering Dispute.SECRETCTK (Previous Papers CP.5809).3864. The Sense of the House of Commons during last nightTs Debate endorsed .the view I had held that the appointment of a Court of Inquiry into the engineering dispute would he inopportune at the moment owing to the existence of the ballot among the unions other than the Amalgamated Sngineer- ing Union on the question. The result of the ballot will be known on. the 25th. Whatever the result, that is, whether the unions accept the memorandum of the employers or reject it, I propose immediately upon the declaration of the ballot, to write to the employers and to all the unions affected suggesting to them that in the interests of their industry and in view of the general anxiety that this dispute coming at so unfortunate a time should be settled, they should meet forthwith and attempt to arrive at an agreement as to their respective positions0 (Initialled) T.J.M. 21st March,1922,
